definition: corner/edge/arris (sharp ridge formed by two surfaces meeting at an edge)/protrusion

sentences.english: It’s a world so full of ambiguities that it requires constant interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 很多时候这个世界经常模棱两可，需要人们不断诠释。

sentences.english: Not only is real life ambiguous, it’s often illogical to the point of madness.
sentences.chinese: 不仅是现实生活模棱两可，它在逻辑上也看似疯狂。

sentences.english: She gives anequivocal answer, typical of a politician.
sentences.chinese: 她给出的答案模棱两可，是典型的政客做派。

sentences.english: Ambiguity and vagueness were no longer an option.
sentences.chinese: 模棱两可和含糊不清已不再为人所接受。

sentences.english: The ambiguity may reflect the intricacies of translation and mistranslation.
sentences.chinese: 这种模棱两可或许反映了翻译与误译的复杂性。

sentences.english: But there is an element of equivocation in some of his statements.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他的很多话中存在着模棱两可的内容。

sentences.english: He should not palter with the truth.
sentences.chinese: 他对事实不应说得模棱两可。

sentences.english: "There is value in ambiguity," Kuehl said.
But luckily the son but ambiguity.

sentences.chinese: 他打着呵欠作了模棱两可的回答。

sentences.english: And that ambiguity is no good for the markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们模棱两可的表态对市场没有任何好处。

sentences.english: Let me just point out an ambiguity. Whats your name?
sentences.chinese: 我来说一个模棱两可的东西，你叫什么？

sentences.english: He kept making ambiguous remarks instead of straight forward yes-or-no replies.
sentences.chinese: 他那模棱两可的回答使我们无法确定其真正意见。

sentences.english: The ancient oracles were often vague and equivocal .
sentences.chinese: 古代的神谕常是意义模糊和模棱两可的。

sentences.english: Why had the divine author permitted himself the ambiguity of simile?
sentences.chinese: 为什么神圣的作者允许自己做模棱两可的比喻？

sentences.english: Her ambiguous remarks made me seized by a profound melancholy.
sentences.chinese: 她模棱两可的评价使得一阵极度的凄伤袭上我的心头。

definition: the king looked left and right and then talked of other things/to digress from the topic of discussion (idiom)
pinyin: wang2 gu4 zuo3 you4 er2 yan2 ta1

definition: apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
